intro: Cyrtandra burbidgei, commonly known as the Burridge's cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in rainforest habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
